title: Week 1: The Wonders of His Love
speaker: Bruxy Cavey

title: Part 2: Tunnel Vision
description: Our identity is not being a hypocrite but we can still be hypocrites on a case by case basis. We need to challenge ourselves to say "no" to the ways of our culture.

title: Part 1: Bobblehead Believers
description: This series is not just about the problems with materialism, it's about the priority of relationships. Relationship is our origin and our identity. It is how we were made and what we were made for. So

title: Part 8: All or Nothing
description: Wrapping up The Great Co-Mission series and Jesus' final words from the Sermon on the Mount while also taking the time to answer some of the questions that were sent in for the series!

title: Part 7: Care
description: Will you take the next step to care for those in need? Consider sponsoring a child today!

title: Part 6: Grow and Invite
description: Learning how to embrace God's mission and turn the call to be a disciple into a daily lifestyle.

title: Part 5: Being Life-Long Learners
description:
Being a disciple of Jesus doesn't mean to have all the answers or only digging into scripture, but to also "get out there" and make being a disciple something practical! 
You are becoming like someon

title: Part 4: Becoming Disciples
description: God wants to partner with our bodies to aid our spiritual growth. Baptism is a wonderful opportunity to experience this. ?Ç¬†

title: Part 3: Our Motivation
description: Should thoughts of Hell be our motivation to evangelize or make disciples?

title: Part 2: Beyond a Doubt
description:
Being a Christ follower is being a part of a safe spiritual community where questions are a part of learning and doubt is a part of faith.
?Ç¬†

title: Part 1: Huddle Up!
description: To be a disciple of Jesus means that will need support, encouragement even training. Will you take the next step to be in active community, grow within your walk with Christ and even help others grow

title: Part Eight: Persecution
description: Do not fear persecution for the sake of Jesus' name, He will never abandon us. The rewards that await in Heaven will be worth it!

title: What's faith got to do with it? (Part 2)
description: What are we doing to keep our faith strong? What things should we avoid to not trip us up?

title: What's faith got to do with it? (Part 1)
description: Hope without faith is just optimism, but hope with faith is assurance. Faith also requires our trust in things we see don't see.

title: Part Seven: Peacemakers
description: Where's Waldo? To be a follower of Christ means to be a peacemaker. Forget the ideas of aggression to achieve you seek, rather offer peace and compassion in times where you feel aggression is the rout

title: Part Six: Pure Heart
description: God wants us to forget about the "spiritual hierarchy" or separation and embrace him as we would embrace a loving father.

title: Part Five: Preeminence of Mercy
description: Should we show mercy to those who we believe don't deserve it? According to God if we show mercy, he will be merciful to us.

title: Part Four: Passion for God's Righteousness
description: We need to set time away to remind ourselves of our hunger and thirst for God. Feeling hunger from not consuming food should be our reminder that we need to be hungry for God.

title: Part Three: Power
description: Give up the attitude of needing to know and control situations and submit that all is happening according to God's plan and will.

title: Part Two: Pleasure-seeking
description: God created us to enjoy pleasure. However, the pleasures should not control us, we need to control our pleasures.

title: Part One: Possessions
description: It's not about how much we give, but what we give in our hearts.

title: Anabaptist Invasion
description: The first followers of Jesus were considered radical. They believed they followed a king and were part of a Kingdom that gave them a radical counter-cultural mission in the world. The early Anabaptist

title: Living Into Focus: Choosing What Matters in an Age of Distraction
description: Choosing what matters in an age of distraction.

title: From the Field to the Party
description: Real security is only found in the Father's love for me.

title: The Young Son's Journey
description: Coming home is coming to the end of myself and opening myself up to be fully known, fully embraced, fully secured and fully loved.

title: Two Lousy Sons
description: The extravagant love of God for us, his children, is revealed in the Parable of the Lost Son.

title: Camping with God
description: Although we can learn about God from a variety of sources (like Scripture, nature, and art), Jesus is the fullness of God?¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s grace and truth.

title: What if God was one of us?
description: Of all creation, only human-kind is made like God, in his image.?Ç¬† Therefore, the human life is the most clear and appropriate vehicle to carry and reveal the will and ways of God in this world.

title: Pastor on the Hot Seat
description: Questions are good...

title: To Shut Down Religion
description: Religion ?¢‚Ç¨‚Äú that is, any system of salvation ?¢‚Ç¨‚Äú is done away with through Jesus.?Ç¬† When this truth sinks in, we will experience transforming freedom, peace, and rest.

title: To Set Up His Kingdom
description: On the cross, Jesus was crowned king of a new kind of kingdom, and he invites his subjects to follow his lead.

title: To Save Us From Sin
description: Through his death and resurrection, Jesus takes away our sin and gives us his purity.

title: Good Friday Service: Forsaken
description: We are not abandoned -- God is with us!

title: To Show Us God's Love
description: The cross shows God's heart of infinite love, even in response to our hate and hostility.

title: Learning to Depend on God
description: The prophet Jeremiah provides an excellent image of two trees ?¢‚Ç¨‚Äú one that has deep roots in living water and bears good fruit. The other unrooted, wandering aimlessly with no hope for the future.

title: Doing Life Together with Jesus
description: Becoming aware of God?¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s presence means tuning into reality.

title: Conversations with God
description: Hearing God's voice through prayer.

title: How's Your Gramma?
description: When we read Scripture to know Jesus, he will speak to us through his Spirit.

title: Hearing the Spirit Through People
description: The Spirit of Christ is in his followeros. He speaks to us through others and other others through us.

title: The Delight and the Danger
description: The Jesus of Scripture is alive and present through his Spirit. And he wants to be friends.

title: Are we there yet?
description: This one week teaching will focus on the significant final leg of the journey for the nation of Israel, as they crossed the Jordan River and entered the Land of Promise.?Ç¬† This was the fulfillment

title: The Word in the World
description: Only once are we born apart from our decision and involvement. God has chosen to make us capable of choosing.

title: Eternity Enters History
description: Jesus is the true light that shines on everyone. That is, in some way, everyone is illuminated, drawn, and convicted by Jesus. This should influence how we share our faith with everyone.

title: Spiritual Photosynthesis
description: Jesus is the Creator who gives life and light.

title: In the Beginning
description: Jesus is God's core message to us, in words and actions.

title: Searching for God
description: The Word of God in print acts like a preservative. It helps keeps the content of our faith free of corruption. But it is never meant to operate apart from the Word of God in people.

title: Hearing from our local community
description: The power that comes from following Jesus through the healing of the blind man in Mark 8.

Week 2: Come a Little Bit Closer
speaker: Matt Vincent

title: Part 1: Becoming You, Only Better
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: As people are reborn onto a new kingdom, we are now visitors, resident aliens in our current nation. This will have implications for how we relate to power and culture. More than visitors, we are ambassadors to wherever we find ourselves, representing the King and kingdom of Christ.

title: Part 2: Wind and Water
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: So, you're saying I need to start all over again? How can I? Why should i? I've come so far. I represent the best of my religion. I want to know how to progress not regress, not restart. That is for converts, not pure born.

title: Part 3: Heart Transplant
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We first invite God to shape our inclinations and impulses into Christ-likeness. Then we find ways to listen to our own hearts.

title: Part 4: Snakes on a Plain
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: As a snake without venom was put on the pole, so a man without sin was put on the cross.

title: Part 5: Amazing Love
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description:
"Jesus came to earth not in order to change God's mind, but to express God's mind."Â 
-- Gary M. Burge

title: Part 6: Here Comes the Judge
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We have the death and resurrection of Jesus to save us We have the life and teachings of Jesus to guide us. We have his Spirit within us to shape us.

description: We get the chance to hear from Sarah Stanley as she shares stories of youth ministry and inspires us to continue to lead students into a growing and lifelong relationship with Jesus.

speaker: Amanda Miles, Karmyn Bokma, Mike Finnie
description: Oakville Teaching -- Three of our pastors, Amanda Miles, Karmyn Bokma and Mike Finnie, revisit our discipleship model for the year - TRUST, GROW, GIVE, GO, TOGETHER. They are excited to share some local stories of God at work in our Oakville site.

title: Part 1: The first thing is Awareness
speaker: Ron Burkholder

title: Local Teaching (Regional Sites)

description: Twice a year we pause our regularly scheduled shared teaching for you to hear from your local lead pastor.

title: Lifeâ€™s Great Dare: Risking It All For The Abundant Life
speaker: Christa Hesselink

title: Good Friday
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: On Good Friday we commemorate what God has done for us through the life and death of Jesus.

title: Week 1: Jesus in Word & Seed
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy rewinds to the beginning of Genesis to see how the Bible points towards Jesus in the first chapters of the Old Testament.

title: Week 2: Jesus The Crucified King
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In the second week of Jesus B.C. Bruxy works through the Psalms and their connections to Jesus.

title: Week 3: Love is the Law
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy looks at the laws in Exodus, Leviticus and Deuteronomy to see the shadow of Jesus and how it points to the substance of Jesus.

title: Week 4: Prophetic Pointers
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy looks at the prophets, specifically Isaiah 53, and how those passages point to Jesus.

title: The Mysterious Stranger
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy visits the only two passages where a mysterious man named Melchizedek appears and how he connects to Jesus.

title: Week 1: Walking on Water
speaker: Jared Taylor
description: Jared dives into the story in the gospels about Jesus walking on water and what that says about Him, God and faith.

title: Week 2: Jesus in the Storm
speaker: Nate Vawser
description: Nate brings the story of The Son of Man and the Sea to a close with Jesus' calming of the storm and how Jesus is connected to the storms we all face.

title: Kairos Moments: The Time is Right
speaker: Jon Hand

title: Week 1: Worship & Welcome
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We begin a new series about the love life of the Trinity and God's invitation for us to join in that divine romance.

title: Week 2: Team Jesus
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy focuses on unpacking the doctrine of our union with Christ.

title: Week 3: Invited into Intimacy
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy expands on our invitation into God's love life, specifically in the area of prayer.

title: Week 4: The Story of Glory
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy speaks on the glorification of our souls through the Holy Spirit.

title: Week 5: Q & Eh?
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy answers your written and video questions in this all "Q & Eh?" Sunday.

title: Part 9: Death by Baptism
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Welcome back to our series about the power of grace, faith, deliverance, and the One chosen by God to redeem people out of slavery and into freedom.

title: Part 10: Bread from Heaven
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy continues to move through Exodus. Just after God had lead His people out of Egypt, He leads them through the wilderness and they begin to accuse God of forgetting about them and start to doubt His provision.

title: Part 11: There Is No Formula
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: As the Israelites continue their journey through the desert, they continue in their struggle to rest their faith in God.

title: Part 12: The Staff and the Sword
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In Exodus 17 we read about a battle between Israel and the Amalekites that takes a strange twist.

title: Part 13: Lessons in Leadership
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In Exodus 18 we read about a time when Moses reached the limits of his leadership, and learned valuable lessons from his father-in-law Jethro.

title: Part 14: Kingdom of Priests
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This week, in our second last Sunday of our summer series, we look at some of the surprising aspects of Exodus 19-20, surrounding Israel's history and the receiving of the Ten Commandments.

title: Part 15: Unveiled Intimacy
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In the final episode of Chosen One: The Law and the Land, Bruxy covers Moses' conversations with God that caused his face to shine and the Apostle Paul's reflections on it.

title: True Greatness
speaker: Vijay Krishnan
description: Vijay breaks down what makes up true greatness for Christ followers.

title: Eyes on the Prize
speaker: Josh Crain
description: Josh shares on multiple ways we can keep ours eyes on Jesus is regular life scenarios.

title: Part 1: Immigrants
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy dives into examples of attempts to create a Jesus Nation and what it means to become a true Jesus Nation as we emigrate from our old lives and into the new with Jesus as Lord.

title: Part 2: Citizens
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description:
Last week we ended with an invitation.
This week we want to start with one.
Follow Jesus, and find out who you really are. 
And who you were meant to be.

title: Part 3: Ambassadors
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy shares next steps on being the ambassadors God meant us to be so we can help this Jesus Nation embassy live and share the gospel.

title: Part 4: Soldiers
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This week we look into our role as soldiers of the Jesus Nation.

title: Week 1: Being Male & Female
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We start off by looking at what inter-relational love is, and being male and female together.

title: Week 2: Marriage (& Family)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy shares what the bible and Jesus say about the power struggles between spouses and family members.

title: Week 3: Sex & the Pornification of Consciousness
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy tackles the subject of pornification and how Jesus calls us out of temptation.

title: Week 4: Friendship & the Family of God
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This week we look at answers to the question of what the concept of friends and family looks like between genders.

title: Week 5: Bonus Q&A Sunday
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In this bonus week of Love, Lust, & Loyalty, Bruxy provides responses to your questions!

title: Part 1: The Brain that Wouldn't Die
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy opens Simple Minded with a focus on decluttering our lives and having the mindset of Christ.

title: Part 2: Liturgies of Love
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In the next episode of Simple Minded, Bruxy shares about training our brains in the norms of a Jesus centred life and defending our minds from the sub-conscious norms of consumerism.

title: Part 3: Following Jesus, Together
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In this episode we focus on training our brains while recognizing that the best way to be trained is in community together.

title: Part 4: Decluttering Through Forgiveness
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: As we continue training our brains, we focus on the power of forgiveness and letting go to declutter our minds.

title: Part 5: Simple Spirituality
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: To conclude Simple Minded, Bruxy reminds us that Jesus and His coming erases the fine-print of religion so we can just focus on becoming more like Christ-like.

title: The Father's Heart
speaker: Lisa Goetze, Anna Lakatos, Rick Wukasch
description: Each of The Meeting House sites get to hear from their own pastors for a Jesus School Sunday to learn more about becoming like Jesus together!

title: The One Foot Journey
speaker: Andrew Farley
description: Andrew Farley invites us on a one-foot journey from our brain to our hearts and speaks about how we can often confuse the motivations of the two.

title: Regional Sites: Local Teaching
speaker: Site Lead Pastor
description: The Meeting House enjoys a morning of local teaching unique to each of our sites. Local pastors or guest speakers make an appearance to help us learn more about becoming like Jesus together!

title: 2017: The Year of Learning, Living, & Giving the Gospel
speaker: Bruxy Cavey

title: Week 1: The Gospel of Peace
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Ephesians 2. We discuss the history of violence leading up to Christâ€™s coming, why his kingdom was shockingly different to what people were expecting, and how the death of Jesus changed everything.

title: Week 2: Our Motive & Method
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Ephesians 4:26-32. We discuss why love and not anger is the right motivation to work for peace, reconciliation, and social justice.

title: Week 3: Lessons from a Soldier
speaker: Bruxy Cavey & Joseph Medina
description: Key Text: 2 Corinthians 7:10-11; 2 Timothy 2:3-4. We interview Joseph Medina, former Marine & Army Guard, and discuss lessons the Church can learn from the Military (and from ants).

title: Week 4: Peace & Non-Judgement
speaker: Bruxy Cavey, Issa Ebombolo & Rick Cober Bauman
description: Key Text: Matthew 7:1-6. We talk about how to be non-judgemental in our peace work, and interview Issa Ebombolo & Rick Cober Bauman about MCC and Peace Clubs.

title: Week 5: Gentle Justice
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Matthew 12:18-21. We discuss violence in the Old Testament and the prophecies of the gentle revolution of the Messiah.

title: Week 6: Hot Seat Sunday
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Luke 4:14-30. We wrap up our Peacemakers series by responding to questions sent in from our sites and podrishioners.

title: Part 1: Possessions
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Luke 18:18-27. We discuss the story of the rich young ruler who, letâ€™s face it, could be any one of us.

title: Part 2: Commitments
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Key Text: Mark 3:31-35. We discuss the Jesusy approach to family, both biological and spiritual.

title: Week 1: Anabaptists & Us
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This episode kicks off our discussion of Anabaptist beliefs and behaviours with a magical mystery whirlwind tour of the history of the Radical Reformation.

title: Week 2: Anabaptists & Scripture
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Anabaptists didnâ€™t follow the Bible. They followed Jesus. And thatâ€™s why they studied the Bible.

title: Week 3: Anabaptists & Church
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The Radical Reformers saw the church, not as an institution, but as a family. And that opened the door for more participation from all ages, stages, and statuses.

title: Long Story Short
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Today we are examining what the early Christians taught about the Good News of Jesus and his resurrection.

title: Week 4: Anabaptists & Peace
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Anabaptists have always rejected the way of violence in favour of Jesusâ€™ way of peaceâ€¦ except when they havenâ€™t. This week we discuss the Munster Rebellion and other Anabaptist failures.

title: Week 5: Anabaptists & Mission
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: How did Anabaptists go from early evangelistic zeal to living in isolationist communities in the country? This week we address this and other challenging questions.

title: The REAL REALLY Good News
speaker: Greg Boyd
description: Our special guest Greg Boyd is here to share why the message of Jesus is really good news for the world and our motivation for sharing it.

title: Week 1: Not Ashamed
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Anabaptists went from being stubbornly evangelistic to becoming â€œthe quiet in the land.â€ In this episode we discuss how we can recapture our original passion for sharing the good news of Jesus.

title: Week 2: God With Us
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Jesus is Immanuel â€“ God with us! Thatâ€™s really good news in two ways: a) Jesus reminds us that God gets us; he really empathizes with the human experience and b) Jesus shows us that God is for us, not against us.

title: Week 3: God's Graphic Love
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel is the good news of Godâ€™s love, and Jesus is Godâ€™s great evidence that he loves us like crazy. When we accept the perfect love of God in Christ Jesus, our fear is cast out.

title: Week 4: Separation Solution
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel includes the good news of salvation from sin. Through Jesus God takes away our sin and offers us complete reconciliation.

title: Week 5: Kingdom Manifesto
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel of Jesus gives purpose to our lives. We are invited to experience and advance the kingdom of God.

title: Week 6: Becoming Ourselves
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel meets our need for self-actualization because the New Covenant teaches us how to live the lives of love we were always meant to live.

title: Jimmy Rushton: Death & Daughters
speaker: Jimmy Rushton
description: Our Downtown Hamilton Lead Pastor Jimmy Rushton reminds us about how Jesus continually redeems our spiritual identity

title: Week 7: You Need To Get Out More
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel meets our need for self-transcendence because Jesus draws us out of ourselves and into a love relationship with the triune God.

title: Week 8: The "F" Word!
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Our response to the gospel is simply to trust that it is true, and to live in light of this love.

title: Week 9: Addendum
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Approximately 700 years before Jesus was born, the prophet Isaiah gave us one of the richest descriptions of the gospel in Isaiah 53.

title: Seeing Jesus in the Poor
speaker: Michael Messenger, World Vision
description: Long time Meeting Houser and President of World Vision Canada, Michael Messengerâ€™s teaching will also include highlights of our engagement in Malawi, as well as casting vision of how we can bring hope to other significant global challenges.

title: Your Love is My Love
speaker: Kate Brown

title: Part 1: Who's Your Daddy

description: The Bible says that Abraham is â€œthe father of us allâ€ and his life provides every believer with invaluable lessons for the journey of faith. Weâ€™re kicking off a new series about the fragile faith of Abraham and the relentless faithfulness of God.

title: Part 1: The Irreligious Religion
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Welcome to our Frosh series! For the next few weeks weâ€™re going to continue our discussion about the faith of Abraham by looking at New Testament texts on the topic.

title: Part 2: Signed, Sealed, Delivered
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Weâ€™re talking about the New Covenant as the covenant of faith instead of law â€“ more like the way God related to Abraham than to Moses.

title: Part 3: The Journey of a Disciple Maker
speaker: Karmyn Bokma
description: Each of our Meeting House sites get to hear local teaching from their own pastors to learn more about discipleship and Jesus together!

title: Part 4: Bewitched!
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We discuss the faith of Abraham and the bewitching power of the law in Galatians 3.

title: Part 3: Local Site Teaching
speaker: Local Site Pastors
description: Each of our Meeting House sites get to hear local teaching from their own pastors to learn more about discipleship and Jesus together!

title: Bad Idea #1: God Is Male
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: When people assume that God is fundamentally male, they will tend to turn elsewhere to find a feminine expression of spirituality. But God is beyond gender, and yet expresses what is best in maleness and femaleness. He is the Father God with the Motherâ€™s heart.

title: Bad Idea #2: We Don't Need God to be Good
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Morality is only present when personhood shows up. And we all live within the Divine Person, in whom we live and move and have our being.

title: Bad Idea #3: The Bible Trumps Jesus
speaker: Brian Zahnd
description: Special Guest Brian Zahnd speaks on the Transfiguration, and why Jesus is the ultimate Word of God.

title: Bad Idea #4: God Tortures People Forever (Part 1)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This week, part one of two on Hell. We examine the traditional view and expose some weaknesses.

title: Bad Idea #4: God Tortures People Forever (Part 2)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: It's Hell Week Part Deux! "So why would I ever trust in a God who tortures people forever?" In this sermon we look at some practical responses to that common question. Plus we dive deeper into understanding more about Conditionalism and Restorationalism.

title: Bad Idea #5: All Religions Lead to God
speaker: Andy Bannister
description: In the multicultural world in which we live, surrounded by a thousand different religions and belief systems, are Christians arrogant for saying Jesus is unique? The bad idea â€œall religions to Godâ€ easily takes hold in such a culture. But why is it a bad idea? And more importantly, what precisely is unique about Jesus?

title: Bad Idea #6: Faith Should Be Private
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: How can Christians be more public with their faith without being Jerks for Jesus?

title: Appendix: Q & Eh
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Bruxy responds to the questions you sent in during the Bad Idea series.

title: Part 1: The Reason for Regifting
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We examine the spiritual gifts listed in Romans 12 and talk about how to give away what weâ€™ve been given. Donâ€™t be a gift hog.

title: Part 2: Regifting the Gospel
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The gospel includes the gift of the Holy Spirit. Weâ€™re talking about regifting this good news for others to hear, embrace, and experience.

title: Part 3: God's Guidance for Regifting
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We all have gifts from God to give away. Now weâ€™re talking about how we can hear Godâ€™s voice clearly to give the right gifts to the right people in the right ways.

title: Christmas Together
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We just love getting together at Christmas to sing to and celebrate Jesus. Weâ€™ll share some stories, read from scripture, sing carols, and reflect on a devotional thought about this very good news: Emmanuel! God With Us!

title: Be In Christ
speaker: Doug Sider
description: We get to hear from Doug on our identity and how we can be loved, belong and become more in Christ.

title: Week 1: Praying Like Jesus
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We learn from Jesus how to pray through the Lordâ€™s Prayer.

title: Week 2: Praying Through Scripture
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: How to use the Bible to meditate and pray conversationally.

title: Week 3: Praying for Harvest
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Practical teaching from Jesus on how to connect our prayer life with our evangelism life.

title: Identity & Inheritance

description: Oakville Associate Lead Pastor Karmyn Bokma teaches us how our identity as adopted sons and daughters transforms our daily life!

title: Week 1 with Jarrod McKenna: The White Elephant in the Room
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Jarrod McKenna helps us kick off our Peacemakers series with a frank discussion about white supremacy and Bruxy gives an exciting update about The Meeting House network!

speaker: Osheta Moore
description: Osheta Moore, author of Shalom Sistas, walks us through the difference between shame and shared suffering, and invites us all to participate in the kingdom culture of true peace.

description: Darrell Winger interviews the MCC Africa Exchange Team and Bruxy talks about our unity in Christ.

speaker: Bruxy Cavey

title: God Speaks To Me
speaker: Ken Shigematsu
description: Weâ€™re excited to hear from Ken Shigematsu, Senior Pastor of Tenth Church and author of God in my Everything.

title: Week 1: How to See God
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: â€œGod is love.â€ We see this truth in Jesus, and when we love like Jesus, we can see it in ourselves.

title: Week 2: How to Fight Fear
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: â€œGod is love,â€ and the Church is meant to be a lived experience of this love. How can we fully enter into this reality today?

title: Recognizing Jesus
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The context is fearful rejection and murderous violence, absorbed by Jesus, and met with forgiveness and the offer of reconciliation.

title: Week 1: Jesus & Buddha Basics
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In our first instalment of our â€œBuddha Bootcampâ€ we learn about the scriptural sources for learning about the lives and teachings of Jesus and Buddha.

title: Week 2: Digging Deeper into Dharma
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: In our second instalment of our â€œBuddha Bootcampâ€ we learn about the teachings and spiritual truths taught by Jesus and in Buddhism.

speaker: Bruxy Cavey & Peter Timmerman
description: In conclusion to our series on the life and teachings of Jesus and Buddha, we are blessed to have an interview with our special guest: Peter Timmerman, York University Professor and Zen Buddhist.

title: Follow Jesus to the Margins
speaker: Michael Messenger
description: World Vision president, Michael Messenger, will teach about Jesusâ€™ willingness to go to the margins to show the transformative power of Godâ€™s love. He will share from the frontlines of the work weâ€™re doing together through our partnership with World Vision.

title: The Scandal
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Welcome back to our ongoing â€œJesus by Johnâ€ series. For the next three Sundays we will be walking through the Gospel of John, chapter 6. We begin at the end, looking at the last few verses of John 6 before going back to the beginning next Sunday.

title: The Bread
speaker: Karmyn Bokma
description: Karmyn Bokma walks us through the miracle of the loaves and fishes.

title: The Blood
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Jesusâ€™ teaching on eating His flesh and drinking His blood. It didnâ€™t go over so well.

title: Teach Me Your Ways
speaker: Sunder Krishnan
description: Sunder Krishnan is a retired pastor who served at Rexdale Alliance Church in Toronto for 36 years. His primary calling in retirement is to preach and mentor the next generation while mobilizing intercessors for the Great Commission.

title: Holy Spirit Flavoured
speaker: Natalie Frisk
description: Welcome to a new week of Home Brewed. This week, we are getting a fresh taste of who and what the Holy Spirit is, and why the Holy Spirit matters so deeply to us today.

description: We learn about intercessory prayer in Genesis 18.

description: Lessons from the story of Sodom and Gomorrah in Genesis 19.

title: Ambassadors Not Antagonists

description: Senior Pastor, Darrell Winger, teaches us about how we are called to be Christâ€™s ambassadors not antagonists.

speaker: Jimmy Rushton
description: Dismantling prejudice & tribalism via mercy, inclusion, and relationship with Jesus.

title: Peace be the Journey
speaker: Kate Brown
description: Kate Brown teaches us how we can experience Godâ€™s peace in the midst of crisis, anxiety, and fear.

title: Being the Church in a Post-Christian World
speaker: Jon Hand
description: The North American and European world has undergone a radical reorientation in its acceptance of the Christian faith and the message of Jesus. Forces are ripping and tearing at our culture as religious foundations erode. What is our response as followers of Jesus? What is the role of the Church in this cultural moment?

title: Becoming Christian in a  Post-Christian World
speaker: Jon Hand
description: We live in a world that focuses more on the outside world of image and status, but the call of Jesus has always been the transformation of our inner world of attitudes, motives, and desires to become Christian (like Jesus). This message explores the process and gives examples of  how spiritual formation can shape us into a transformed people in this cultural moment.

title: Part 6: Courage My Love
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Lessons from the story of Abraham and Abimelek in Genesis 20.

title: Part 1: Trust
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We kick off a new series about discipleship, with an emphasis on learning to obey everything Jesus has commanded. We talk about our strained relationship with the concept of obediance, and we learn from Matthew 4 about that awkward time Jesus came to be baptized, but John the Baptist just didn't get it.

title: Part 2: Grow
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We discuss from Matthew 7 the importance of putting into practice what we are learning from Jesus.

title: Part 3: Give
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We talk about love expressed through giving our time, attention, and wealth to others.

title: Hospitable Hearts and Homes
speaker: Lisa Goetze
description: Oakville Pastor Lisa Goetze teaches us how the New Testament Church displayed hospitality and how we can follow Jesus by welcoming others into our homes and lives.

title: Week 1: Did Jesus Exist?
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We explore the question of whether we can know if the Jesus of Nazareth we find in Scripture was a real historical figure.

title: Week 2: What about the Miracles?
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Are miracles in the Christmas story a good reason not to believe it?

title: Week 3: The Strongest Evidence (Part 1)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The teaching of Jesus may be the best evidence we have that Jesus works miracles and is sent by God. This week we look at how his teaching addresses our human need for love and forgiveness.

title: Week 4: The Strongest Evidence (Part 2)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: The teaching of Jesus may be the best evidence we have that Jesus works miracles and is sent by God. This week we look at how his teaching addresses our human need for purpose, peace, self-actualization and self-transcendence.

title: The Cruciform Way
speaker: Jon Hand
description: Site Leadership Pastor, Jon Hand, dives into the effects of forgiveness and leads in a time of forgiveness as a mental practice.

title: WEEK 1: Community of the Broken
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We begin our new series on cultivating bold honesty through the Psalms. Today we are walking through Psalm 32.

title: WEEK 2: Survival Habits of the Soul
speaker: Ken Shigematsu
description: Ken Shigematsu from Tenth Church shares a message on pursuing achievement and providing a life of significant contribution, not out of a need to validate ourselves, but out of a deep sense of inner rest and gratitude that we are already accepted by God.

title: WEEK 3: Broken Promises
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Psalm 38 shows us how the Bible doesnâ€™t make sense without Jesus â€“ just like our lives.

title: WEEK 4: You've Been Found
speaker: Darrell Winger
description: We learn from Psalm 139 on being found and loved by the God of the universe.

title: Week 1: Seeing The Big Picture
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We discuss why it is so important to have gender equality in church leadership.

title: Week 2: Jesus & the New Covenant
speaker: Karmyn Bokma
description: Karmyn Bokma teaches on how patriarchy in the Old Covenant was God's accommodation for a season, yet Jesus restores the relationships between men and women in the New Covenant.

title: Week 3: Marriages That Preach
speaker: Leanne Friesen
description: Leanne Friesen teaches from Ephesians 5 on the New Covenant design for marriage.

title: Week 4: Learning from the Prohibitive Passages
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We walk through 1 Timothy 2, the passage most commonly used to argue against women leading in the Church.

title: Week 5: A Few Good Ezers
speaker: Jo Saxon
description: Jo Saxton teaches us how to empower women and explores the true meaning of the word helper in Genesis 2:18.

title: Week 6: Q & Eh?
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We respond to your questions about Her Story.

title: Jesus Collective - Our Kingdom Moment with Greg Boyd + Guests
speaker: Maggie John, Greg Boyd, Josh Crain, Matt Vincent,
description: Together, we cast a vision for Jesus Collective, hearing from Greg Boyd and our guest panel about why now is the time to unite a Kingdom movement.

title: Deconstruction
speaker: Jimmy Rushton
description: Jimmy Rushton walks through John 3 and how Jesus welcomes the questions and doubts of Nicodemus.

title: Doubt
speaker: Jimmy Rushton
description: Jimmy Rushton explores the biblical precedent for doubt in our walk with Jesus.

title: Week 1: The Story of Everything
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: Jesus is God in human flesh, who dwelt among us and taught us how to live. This is His story. This is our story.

title: Week 2: Those Dry Bones!
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We walk through the prophecy of Ezekiel 37 and how Jesus is the fulfillment.

title: Easter Sunday (Week 3)
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: We celebrate Jesus coming back to life!

title: Week 4: Death and Discipleship
speaker: Bruxy Cavey
description: This is the first week of two where we look at why Jesus died, in his own words.
